description: Borrowed from French aubade, from Old French albade, from Old Spanish albada (“musical or poetic composition to be performed in the morning”), from alba (“dawn”), from Vulgar Latin *alba (“dawn; sunrise”), from Latin albus (“bright, clear; white”), ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *albʰós (“white”).

definitionGroups.group: (music, poetry) A poem or song evoking or greeting the dawn or early morning.

entries.meaning: (music, specifically) A morning love song, or a song of lovers parting in the morning.
(music) A concert held at dawn or in the morning, especially outdoors.
